title: Mario Balotelli's answer to question about Liverpool perfectly sums up his Anfield career
text:
Sport Mario Balotelli's answer to question about Liverpool perfectly sums up his Anfield career Nearly two years after his last appearance for The Reds, the Italian striker can still make Liverpool fans smile… sort of Share Mario Balotelli in his not-so-happy days at Liverpool (Photo: PA) Share Get Liverpool FC   Could   
Mario Balotelli never disappoints. 
Undoubtedly a talented footballer, the striker who has frustrated a succession of top managers has always been an even more talented talker. 
A case in point: his latest interview, for RMC in France. 
Now scoring regularly for Nice in the French top flight, the Italian was happy to talk about all manner of subjects during a typically forthright chat. (Photo: AFP/Getty) 
He discussed Nice's title chances at length ("I am not interested in being second or third, I play to win"), the standard of Ligue 1 ("The Premier League will always be the best league in the world") and his chances of returning to the Italian national team ("If they call, I will be ready"). 
He even claimed that he almost signed for Barcelona as a youngster: “I nearly joined Barcelona, but the club that had me at the time wanted money". Read More 
However, when asked about his time at Liverpool, he suddenly became considerably less chatty. (Photo: Alex Livesey) 
His exact response? 
“Don’t speak to me about Liverpool, please." 
Here's a thought, Mario. You last played for Liverpool in April 2015, nearly two years ago. 
Might be time to let it go, mate.
